intro: Sebastiania ditassoides, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
